--- title: "Kelly Sovacool" description: | Bioinformatician building and applying open source software aliases: - about.html image: images/pibs_profile.jpg about: template: trestles id: about image-width: 10em image-shape: round links: - icon: github href: https://github.com/kelly-sovacool - icon: envelope href: mailto:kelly@sovacool.dev - icon: mastodon href: https://mastodon.social/@kelly_sovacool rel: me - icon: twitter href: https://twitter.com/kelly_sovacool - icon: linkedin href: https://linkedin.com/in/kelly-sovacool - text: "{{< fa brands orcid >}}" # https://github.com/quarto-ext/fontawesome/issues/6 href: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3283-829X execute: echo: false engine: jupyter --- :::{#about} Hi, I'm Kelly! I work remotely as a Bioinformatics Software Engineer for [Frederick National Lab](https://frederick.cancer.gov/). I completed my PhD in [Bioinformatics](https://medicine.umich.edu/dept/computational-medicine-bioinformatics) in [Pat Schloss' lab](http://www.schlosslab.org/) at the University of Michigan, where I developed bioinformatics tools and data analysis pipelines for microbial ecology and host-associated microbiome research. I'm a fan of open science, open source software, and reproducible research. When I'm not in the dry lab, you might find me running, cycling, climbing, or otherwise being active outside. While pursuing my PhD at UMich, I volunteered with [Girls Who Code](http://umich.edu/~girlswc/), taught [Software Carpentry](https://umcarpentries.github.io/) workshops, and hosted [CoderSpaces office hours](https://datascience.isr.umich.edu/events/coderspaces/). I also moonlight as a [live sound engineer](https://sovacool.dev/latex-cv/sound.pdf) from time to time. ::: :::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-2 .g-col-md-2 style="text-align: left;"} ::: ::: {.g-col-8 .g-col-md-8 }
-->
::: ::: {.g-col-2 .g-col-md-2 style="text-align: left;"} ::: ::::
